column5: The 1969 snowfall record has been broken by 3cms. It will continue to snow heavily 'til 7 or 8PM with heavy winds. Current winds are NNE at 46kph gusting to 59kph. Highways are closed everywhere. At least J and I are home with a fire happening and we're just starting to make a really nice supper. I won't even bother to start up Big Bertha to clean the driveway....the wind and snow are just overwhelming for the time being. I'll take pics here as soon as I have the chance.  Hope everyone is safe and comfortable.
I would just stay inside and wait for global warming
You take care as well Roy,that must of hit you mighty hard. Heard Kingston received a fair bit as well.
We got hit with it yesterday - maybe 4" to 6" inches (not all that much).   Nice wild ride on the way home from work yesterday.  No snow today, but some good wind gusts blowing through.
Lots of random acts of kindness happening here.

I'd like to see the pictures later for sure , we left here last night at  midnight  to move sno and finished at 10 this morning ,  as it kept up storming we will be leaveing here shortly to do it over one more time , then it will be sleeep time ....  lol
Waste high snow the full length of my driveway, drifts 5 feet on the lower deck. The dogs cant even get out for a pee:o

We got more snow here yesterday then I think we did over the last two years. I went out at 11pm put gas in the snowblower for the first time in two winters and she fired up first pull. Hope you guys make out good with super then get lots of sleep before running birtha

It's about time we had some snow on the ground!!!! After the lack there of last year I was beginning to wonder if Al(Chicken Little) Gorre wasn't as out of his mind as I thought he was....er... is. Like too see some pictures for sure Roy. Stay safe and enjoy the down time.

Sounds like your getting hammered over your way Roy, but good to hear you guys are surviving intact. Nice being retired eh, and not having to drive around town in all that mess.  We got about 5" here but it still took me a couple hours to clean everything up but that's OK, as I enjoy doing that kinda stuff.
4-5 inches here in Oshawa. That's enough for me. Relax around the fire Roy and wait for Wiarton Willie to tell you it's safe to come out.

Yup...  My truck was plowing with the bumper/grill in the driveway... Lol  Lots of stuck cars and lots of folks willing to help push.... Went from almost no snow to 4 foot snow banks...  The street plows are just now starting to catch up in my neighborhood and I live across the road from the hospital....  Lots of abulances going out today too...  SLOW DOWN in these conditions please.....  Go figure... My brother just sold his Ski-Doo.... Lol
Hey Roy, make sure to tie a 3 foot pole and flag on the top of your hat so we know where you are in the picture !!  :tease:

The Plow trucks and sanders on on red alert here in toronto, we got a huge dumping of about 1" throughout the day. Most of it is still on the ground, cars are in the ditches, and grocery stores are selling out of canned goods.
LOL! It wouldn't surprise me Jedimaster
Have they called in the Army yet?

You are all a bunch of WIMPS in 1958 me and my buddy got BUSTED by his mother for jumping out of a 3rd story window into a snow drift in Quebec city.AND she was ONLY worried about the hardwood floor.I have pictures of the snow in our back yard that are 7 to 8 ft high.What a RUSH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  vance
Remember Winters in Gagetown? Open the door to go to school, and be met by a wall of snow higher than the house:w00t: ...........This aint nothin'.
Yeah Merc gagetown was bad BUT one winter in Petawawa we got about a foot of snow every week for about five weeks and I had 3 driveways to shovel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  vance
Yep Mike just south of you and we got seven inches. I was so looking forward to using my brand new snow blower and wouldn't ya know it ....yep wouldn't start. That's alright I needed the exercise

3 - 4 feet of snow is called just snow fall here........  Beat this storm if you can......  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blizzard_of_1977     And finally...check out this website...... https://www.google.com/search?q=Blizzard+of+'77&hl=en&client=gmail&tbo=u&rls=gm&tbm=isch&source=univ&sa=X&ei=nk7gUITzGIqx0QGR1IDgBA&ved=0CEkQsAQ&biw=1024&bih=653
I am just posting this picture for Roy , its of the bus stop just down the street from his house this morning .........
